revised_title: The Use of Agaric of Oak in Stopping Hemorrhages: Case Studies
tldr: This article presents case studies on the use of agaric of oak in stopping hemorrhages after amputations. The agaric was applied to the mouths of the principal arteries to effectively control bleeding without causing pain. The author also explains the mechanism of action, which involves the contraction of the extremities of the divided vessels, allowing the agaric to resist the force of circulation.
